name: Geopaparazzi
tagline: Because not all paparazzis are evil!
body:
Geopaparazzi is a tool developed to do very fast qualitative engineering/geologic surveys. Even if the main aim is in the field of surveying, it contains tools that can be of great use also to [OpenStreetMappers](http://www.openstreetmap.org/) as well as tourists that want to keep a geo-diary.
Geopaparazzi is now available on the Android Market. Search for geopaparazzi on your phone or get it from the [online android market](http://market.android.com/details?id=eu.hydrologis.geopaparazzi).

![Geopaparazzi](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/wiki/images/50_ctp.png)

To get started jump into [the documentation section](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/wiki).

If you are interested in the GIS integration of Geopaparazzi, [check this doc out](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/wiki#wiki-import-data-into-a-gis).

The main aim of Geopaparazzi is to have a tool that:

* fits in any pocket and can be always at hand, when needed
* gives the possibility to take georeferenced and possibly orientated pictures during the survey, with further possibility to import them into the main GIS application BeeGIS
* is able to exploit easily internet connection, if available.
* is extremely easy to use and intuitive, providing just few important functionalities.

The main features available in Geopaparazzi are:

* georeferenced notes
* georeferenced and orientated pictures
* gps tracks logging
* easy export of collected data
* a map view for the navigation of the environment

# What has been done so far

Apart of the [the documentation section](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/wiki), which tries to reflect the state of art, you can have a look at the [release notes](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/wiki/Release-notes).

# Tested devices

We try to keep a list of devices that users reported to have tested with Geopaparazzi, you can [find it here](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/wiki/Tested-Phones).

# Projects using it

Sometimes geopaparazzi gets customized for particular projects and reasons. Here are [the projects we know of](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/wiki/Projects-Using-It).

# Translations

Geopaparazzi has already been translated in quite some languages.

Do you want to see Geopaparazzi in your language? With transifex it is a simple task. Check out the [translation page](https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/geopaparazzi/) and send us your contributions.


# Need help?

Subscribe to the users [mailinglist](http://groups.google.com/group/geopaparazzi-users), we are here to help you! 

We also have a [mailinglist for developers](http://groups.google.com/group/geopaparazzi-devel).

# Found bugs? 

If you found a bug, please [report it in our issue tracker](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/issues). We will check it and work on it as soon as we can.

# Need features?

If you would like to see new features in geopaparazzi, you have a few ways to get there:

* develop them yourself and [contribute them to the project via pull requests](https://help.github.com/articles/using-pull-requests)
* hire someone to do that for you
* create a new feature request in our [issue tracker](https://github.com/geopaparazzi/geopaparazzi/issues) and wait for someone interested to do it

# Donations

If you find this application useful for your job, please consider to donate to support the development. Donations to this project support the development of:
* [jgrasstools](http://www.jgrasstools.org/)
* [JGrass](http://www.jgrass.org/) 
* [BeeGIS](http://code.google.com/p/beegis/)
* and obviously [Geopaparazzi](http://www.geopaparazzi.eu).

Thanks for helping to keep this development free and open source. 

[Paypal donation link](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=84U4N2DVQ74S6&lc=IT&item_name=JGrass%20BeeGIS%20Geopaparazzi%20Donations&item_number=jgrassdonations&currency_code=EUR&bn=PP%2dDonationsBF%3abtn_donateCC_LG%2egif%3aNonHosted)
